{"step_by_step_thinking": "The infra temporal fossa is a complex anatomical area located on the side of the skull. It contains several structures, including muscles, nerves, and blood vessels. The main arterial supply to this area comes from the maxillary artery, which is a major branch of the external carotid artery. The other options listed, such as the infratemporal artery, deep temporal artery, and posterior superior alveolar artery, are branches of the maxillary artery, but they are not the main arterial trunk supplying the infra temporal fossa.", "answer_choice": "C. Maxillary artery"}
